page.title: 20Historical buildings
page.content: It is of interest to note that the block comprises part of what was originally two estates owned by the Dunbars of Hempriggs and the Sinclairs of Ulbster. Sir John Sinclair of Ulbster compiled the first statistical account of Scotland.His estates included Tannach Mains Farm which was exchanged over 100 yrs.ago with the Dunbars for Strathmore lodge which is still held by his descendants.Though a listed building the farmhouse is derelict and was last occupied in 1980. Thrumster House was built by Brodie in 1710 for the Sinclairs and passed out of their hands in the 19th.century.It is privately owned and in good repair. Hempriggs House was built in 1692 for Wm.Dunbar of Ackergill.It was held by his descendants till recently.It is privately owned but unoccupied.
